item.title: Declutter a shiny reportâ€™s code
item.description: Shiny reports are awesome, but they sure do end up with many lines of code when adding lots of inputs and outputs. A ui.R file can rapidly exceed 50 lines of code and I prefer to keep things more compact. The best way I’ve found of doing that in other languages and in R is to modularise my code – break it down into independent chunks. Shiny already does this by having a server() and ui() section and allowing you to source other files.
